p: Both F Rich and F Disp exhibited geographic patterns wherein maximum values were in the main known glacial refugia for non-boreal temperate species in Southern Europe (notably, Italian and Balkan peninsulas 38). Large F Rich and F Disp values were also in areas of high topographic variability (Pyrenees and Alps) that provide a buffer against climatic variations, and in regions that are highly accessible to postglacial colonization 2 5. The tendency towards high F Rich and F Disp in areas know to be glacial refugia and have a wide elevation heterogeneity was generalized across evaluated orders.
